quiz_questions.instruction_text: What is the order of items in the Product Backlog?
answer_options: The recently added items at the top
Less valuable and most unclear items at the bottom
The less clear items at the top
Alphabetical
quiz_questions.answer: Less valuable and most unclear items at the bottom
quiz_questions.verbose: The Product Owner is responsible for placing the most valuable and clear items at the top of the Product Backlog.

quiz_questions.instruction_text: If an inspector determines that one or more aspects of a process deviate outside acceptable limits, when must an adjustment be made?
answer_options: After clarifying all the details with the Product Owner
As soon as possible to minimize further deviation
The deviations should be discussed at the Daily Scrum and then an adjustment must be made
After Scrum Master approval
quiz_questions.answer: As soon as possible to minimize further deviation
quiz_questions.verbose: If an inspector determines that one or more aspects of a process deviate outside acceptable limits, and that the resulting product will be unacceptable, the process or the material being processed must be adjusted. An adjustment must be made as soon as possible to minimize further deviation.

quiz_questions.instruction_text: Scrum is NOT a process or technique. True or False?
answer_options: True
False
quiz_questions.verbose: Scrum is not a process, technique, or definitive method. Rather, it is a framework within which you can employ various processes and techniques.

answer_options: It is a meeting where the Development Team synchronizes activities and creates a plan for the next 24 hours
It is the key inspect and adapt meeting
It is a meeting to inspect the Increment and adapt the Product Backlog if needed
It is an opportunity for the Scrum Team to inspect itself and create a plan for improvements to be enacted during the next Sprint
quiz_questions.answer: It is an opportunity for the Scrum Team to inspect itself and create a plan for improvements to be enacted during the next Sprint
quiz_questions.verbose: The Sprint Retrospective is an opportunity for the Scrum Team to inspect itself and create a plan for improvements to be enacted during the next Sprint.

quiz_questions.instruction_text: The Development Team should be able to explain to the Product Owner and Scrum Master how it intends to work as a self-organizing team to accomplish the Sprint Goal and create the anticipated Increment.
answer_options: True
False
quiz_questions.verbose: By the end of the Sprint Planning, the Development Team should be able to explain to the Product Owner and Scrum Master how it intends to work as a self-organizing team to accomplish the Sprint Goal and create the anticipated Increment.

quiz_questions.instruction_text: Who has the authority to cancel the Sprint?
answer_options: The Key Stakeholders
The Development Team
The Product Owner and the Scrum Master
The Scrum Master
The Product Owner
quiz_questions.verbose: Only the Product Owner has the authority to cancel the Sprint, although he or she may do so under influence from the stakeholders, the Development Team, or the Scrum Master.
